TLDR: A software development principle to follow with an example. Today, I got feedback from a code review and learned something new. It was about “magic numbers”, which are unique values with unexplained meaning or multiple occurrences which could (preferably) be replaced with named constants.
I’ve known about the concept of using constants rather than hard-coding values, but I didn’t think of that for “magic number” situations. It’s a pretty simple concept but I just wanted to share what I learned.
